title: Agricultural Water
description: Comprehensive agricultural water management requirements including source identification, quality standards, microbial testing, treatment systems, and distribution system maintenance for pre-harvest and post-harvest water use

requirements.text: Are all water sources used for the operation identified and is the intended use for each source documented?
mandatoryStatements: All water sources are identified (wells, surface water, municipal, etc.)
Each water source has documented intended use
Uses include irrigation, spray applications, hand washing, equipment washing, etc.
Water sources are shown on site map
Source identification supports traceability and testing programs
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that all water sources are identified and documented
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update water source documentation when changes occur

requirements.text: Is there a documented water management system covering, as applicable: source, delivery, storage, distribution, quality, testing, and treatment of water?
mandatoryStatements: Water management system is documented
System addresses water source characterization
System addresses water delivery and distribution
System addresses water storage if applicable
System addresses water quality standards and testing
System addresses water treatment if applicable
System is reviewed and updated annually
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of water management system documentation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update system when operational changes affect water use

requirements.text: Has a documented pre-harvest agricultural water assessment been developed addressing all water used directly or indirectly on the growing area during growing activities?
mandatoryStatements: Pre-harvest agricultural water assessment is documented
Assessment covers all water used directly on growing areas (irrigation, sprays)
Assessment covers all water used indirectly affecting growing areas
Assessment evaluates risk from each water source and use
Assessment identifies control measures for identified risks
Assessment is reviewed at least annually
Assessment is updated when water sources or uses change
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of pre-harvest water assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate assessment update when water-related changes occur

requirements.text: Is water used directly on the growing area during growing activities (e.g., irrigation, foliar application) sourced from a source determined to be safe or does the water meet required microbial quality standards (generic E. coli not to exceed a geometric mean of 126 CFU per 100 mL and a statistical threshold value of 410 CFU per 100 mL)?
mandatoryStatements: Water used directly on growing areas meets microbial quality standards OR source is determined safe
If testing required: generic E. coli geometric mean does not exceed 126 CFU/100mL
If testing required: no single sample exceeds statistical threshold value of 410 CFU/100mL
Testing conducted by qualified laboratory using approved methods
Test results are documented and reviewed
Water not meeting standards is not used until corrected and re-tested
Safe source determination is documented with scientific rationale
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review of all water test results, verification that non-compliant water is not used
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Water testing at frequencies determined by risk assessment, immediate action if standards exceeded

requirements.text: Where pre-harvest agricultural water does not meet the required microbial quality standards, are mitigations being used to ensure the safety of the crop?
mandatoryStatements: If water does not meet standards, documented mitigation is implemented
Mitigation options include water treatment, time intervals before harvest, crop treatment, etc.
Mitigation is scientifically based and appropriate for risk level
Effectiveness of mitigation is verified
Mitigation is documented in water management system
Records demonstrate consistent application of mitigation measures
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that mitigations are implemented as planned
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing monitoring of mitigation effectiveness, immediate action if mitigation fails

requirements.text: Is water used in mixing/applying crop sprays (e.g., crop protectants, growth regulators, foliar nutrients) of appropriate quality?
mandatoryStatements: Water used for mixing crop sprays is of appropriate quality
Water quality standards are defined for spray applications
Water is tested or source is verified as safe
Water quality does not compromise spray effectiveness or food safety
Records document water source used for spray mixing
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of spray water quality
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Periodic testing based on risk assessment

requirements.text: Is water used for hand washing of appropriate microbial quality (potable or meeting EPA or local requirements)?
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing water is potable or meets EPA/local drinking water standards
Water quality is verified through testing or municipal water reports
Test results are documented
Non-compliant water is not used for hand washing
If municipal water, documentation of water quality is obtained
If well water, testing is conducted at appropriate frequency
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of hand washing water quality
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Annual testing minimum for wells, immediate testing if contamination suspected

requirements.text: Is water that directly or indirectly contacts harvested product during or after harvest (including water used to make ice) of appropriate microbial quality (potable or meeting EPA or local requirements)?
mandatoryStatements: Post-harvest water contacting product is potable or meets EPA/local standards
Water used to make ice meets potable water standards
Water quality is verified through testing or municipal reports
Test results are documented
Testing frequency is based on risk but minimum annually
Non-compliant water is not used until corrected and re-tested
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual minimum verification of post-harvest water quality
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Testing at defined frequencies, immediate testing if contamination suspected

requirements.text: Is water used for washing or rinsing food contact surfaces (e.g., harvest containers, equipment) of appropriate microbial quality (potable or meeting EPA or local requirements)?
mandatoryStatements: Water used for washing food contact surfaces is potable or meets standards
Water quality is verified through testing or documentation
Test results are maintained
Non-compliant water is not used for washing food contact surfaces
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of equipment wash water quality
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Annual testing minimum, immediate testing if contamination suspected

requirements.text: Where water treatment (e.g., chlorination, UV, filtration, ozone) is used, is there a documented water treatment plan and are there records confirming that the treatment is working effectively?
mandatoryStatements: Water treatment plan is documented
Plan specifies treatment method, target parameters, and monitoring frequency
Treatment equipment is properly maintained
Treatment effectiveness is monitored (e.g., chlorine residuals, UV intensity)
Monitoring records are maintained
Corrective actions are taken when treatment is ineffective
Treatment system is validated initially and verified ongoing
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of treatment monitoring records, annual validation of treatment effectiveness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Real-time or daily monitoring of treatment parameters, immediate action if out of specification

requirements.text: If water storage tanks or reservoirs are used, are they constructed, located, covered and maintained to prevent contamination?
mandatoryStatements: Water storage tanks are constructed of food-grade or appropriate materials
Tanks are located to minimize contamination risk
Tanks are covered to prevent entry of debris, animals, and contaminants
Tank inlets and outlets are protected
Tanks are inspected regularly for integrity and cleanliness
Tanks are cleaned and sanitized at appropriate intervals
Cleaning and inspection records are maintained
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of water storage tanks
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly visual inspection, annual internal inspection and cleaning

requirements.text: Are water distribution systems (pipes, hoses, irrigation systems, etc.) maintained and managed to prevent contamination?
mandatoryStatements: Water distribution system is maintained in good repair
No cross-connections between potable and non-potable water systems
Hoses and pipes are stored properly when not in use (off ground, capped)
System is protected from back-siphonage and backflow
Distribution system is inspected regularly for leaks and damage
Repairs are made promptly
System is flushed or cleaned if contamination occurs
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of water distribution system
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly visual checks during active use, immediate repair of leaks or damage

requirements.text: Are water testing methods, laboratories and sampling procedures appropriate and documented?
mandatoryStatements: Water testing is conducted by qualified laboratory
Laboratory uses validated test methods (EPA-approved or equivalent)
Sampling procedures are documented and followed
Samples are collected by trained personnel
Sample integrity is maintained during transport
Chain of custody is documented if required
Test methods are appropriate for the water matrix and use
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of laboratory qualifications and test methods
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Review each test report for completeness and validity

requirements.text: Where water testing results do not meet required standards, are documented corrective actions taken and is the effectiveness of corrective actions verified through re-testing?
mandatoryStatements: Water not meeting standards is not used for intended purpose
Root cause of water quality failure is investigated
Corrective actions are implemented (treatment, source change, system repair, etc.)
Corrective actions are documented
Effectiveness is verified through re-testing
Water is not used until re-test confirms acceptable quality
Preventive measures are implemented to prevent recurrence
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review all corrective action records for water quality failures
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate corrective action when test failures occur, re-testing before resuming water use

requirements.text: Are all water quality records maintained and readily available?
mandatoryStatements: All water test results are maintained
Water treatment monitoring records are maintained
Corrective action records for water issues are maintained
Records are organized and readily retrievable
Records are retained for at least 24 months or longer if required
Records support traceability and audit requirements
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly audit of water quality record retention and organization
requirements.monitoringExpectations: File records immediately upon receipt, periodic organization of records

capaInject: If water sources not identified: immediately document all water sources and intended uses
If water management system not documented: develop comprehensive system within 30 days
If pre-harvest water assessment not conducted: complete assessment within 30 days, do not use unevaluated water sources
If irrigation water exceeds microbial standards: immediately discontinue use, investigate source, treat or find alternative source, implement mitigation, re-test before use
If spray mixing water inappropriate quality: switch to appropriate water source immediately
If hand washing water not potable: provide potable water immediately, test well water or obtain municipal documentation
If post-harvest water not potable: immediately discontinue use, product hold if suspect contamination, provide potable water, test before resuming use
If equipment wash water not appropriate: switch to potable water immediately
If water treatment not effective: immediate corrective action, do not use water until treatment verified effective
If storage tanks contaminated or not maintained: clean and sanitize immediately, test water before use
If distribution system compromised: repair immediately, flush system, test water quality
If testing methods inappropriate: switch to qualified laboratory, re-test using appropriate methods
If water test failures not addressed: immediate investigation, corrective action, re-testing before water use
If water records not maintained: implement record keeping system immediately
traceabilityInject: Water sources must be traceable to specific locations on site map
Water test results must be traceable to specific sources, sampling dates, and laboratories
Water treatment records must be traceable to specific treatment systems, dates, and parameters
Corrective actions for water quality failures must be traceable to specific test results and verification testing
